sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not associative with respect to Cartesian product.
message_1: Let A = {1, 3} and B = {1, 2}. Find the value of (A △ B) △ {4} and A △ (B △ {4}) using the property of symmetric difference and Cartesian product. Show that the two values are not equal, thus proving that the symmetric difference of two sets is not associative with respect to Cartesian product.
